alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Rawlins (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 11:26PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Cheyenne, northwestern Rawlins Counties in northwestern Kansas and Dundy Counties in southwestern Nebraska through 1115 PM MDT/1215 AM CDT/... At 1026 PM MDT/1126 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Benkelman, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Cheyenne, northwestern Rawlins Counties in northwestern Kansas and Dundy Counties in southwestern Nebraska, including the following locations... Parks, Wheeler and Max. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM MDT/400 AM CDT/ for northwestern Kansas...and southwestern Nebraska.
